豪雨包括復旧策を決定…政府、予備費１３００億円活用

07 Nov 2019, 13:13

　政府は７日、非常災害対策本部会議を首相官邸で開き、台風１５号や１９号など一連の豪雨・暴風被害に関する包括的な復旧策となる「対策パッケージ」を決めた。被災者の生活や産業の再建に向け、安倍首相は２０１９年度予算の予備費から約１３００億円を支出し、直ちに支援を実行すると表明した。８日に閣議決定する。
　首相は会議で「被災地のニーズや地域ごとの特性を踏まえ、きめ細かな取り組みを加速させていく」と強調した。
　対策パッケージは緊急対応策としてまとめられたものだ。生活再建に向け、住宅が全壊した世帯に最大３００万円の被災者生活支援金を支給し、一部損壊の世帯も支援する。廃棄物や土砂を生活圏から年内に撤去するため、省庁ごとに異なる撤去の制度を一体運用し、効率化を図ることも盛り込んだ。生活の足を維持するため、鉄道の代行バスの運行経費を支援するほか、経営基盤の弱い鉄道会社の復旧を資金面で後押しする。
　産業再生では、被害が大きかった宮城、福島、栃木、長野の４県で、中小企業向けに復旧費用の４分の３を国や県が負担する「グループ補助金」を通して支援を行う。被災自治体が事業者の負担割合を４分の１以上で自由に設定できる「自治体連携型補助金」を新設する。
　農業では、冠水被害に遭ったリンゴなどの果樹農家や、倉庫などが浸水した稲作農家を対象に支援策を講じる。観光では、被災した１４都県で宿泊代金を１人当たり５０００円値引きする。
　政府は１８年の西日本豪雨でも、予備費約１７００億円を財源とする包括的な被災者支援策をまとめている。

Decided to recover from heavy rains ... Government uses 130 billion yen of reserves

07 Nov 2019, 13:13

The government held an emergency disaster response headquarters meeting at the prime minister's office on the 7th, and decided on a “measure package” that would be a comprehensive recovery measure against a series of heavy rains and storms such as typhoon No.15 and No.19. Prime Minister Abe announced that he would pay about 130 billion yen from the reserve for the FY2019 budget and immediately provide support for rebuilding the lives and industries of the victims. The Cabinet will decide on the 8th.
“The prime minister emphasized at the meeting,“ We will accelerate detailed efforts based on the needs of the affected areas and the characteristics of each region. ”
Measure package is compiled as an emergency response. In order to rebuild their lives, up to 3 million yen will be provided to victims whose homes have been completely destroyed, and partially damaged households will also be supported. In order to remove waste and earth and sand from the sphere of living within the year, the system also incorporates an integrated operation of different removal systems for each ministry and agency to improve efficiency. In addition to supporting the cost of operating the proxy buses for maintaining a livelihood, the company will provide financial support for the recovery of a railway company with a weak management base.
In industrial revitalization, Miyagi, Fukushima, Tochigi, and Nagano, which suffered significant damage, will provide support to SMEs through “group subsidies,” where the government and prefectures will pay three quarters of the recovery costs. Establish a “local government-linked subsidy” that allows the disaster-affected local governments to freely set the burden ratio of businesses at a quarter or more.
In agriculture, support measures will be taken for fruit farmers such as apples that have been inundated, and rice farmers whose warehouses have been submerged. In tourism, accommodation is discounted by 5000 yen per person in the 14 prefectures affected by the disaster.
The government has compiled a comprehensive support plan for disaster victims with a reserve of about 170 billion yen even in the heavy rains of West Japan in 2018.
